newsitem.title: INDIA: Delhi shares up in afternoon trade on budget hopes.
newsitem.headline: Delhi shares up in afternoon trade on budget hopes.

text.p: Delhi share prices quoted higher in afternoon trade on Thursday, buoyed by prospects that parliament would approve the Finance Bill containing budget proposals for 1997/98 (April-March), brokers said.
At 12.45 p.m. (0715 GMT), the Delhi Stock Exchange's sensitive index was 4.54 points higher at 772.65.
The budget presented proposals for cuts in import duties and personal taxation. Parliament was continuing a debate on the Finance Bill on Thursday and was expected to vote on it by the weekend.
"Foreign investors and speculators made some purchases on hopes that the Finance Bill will be approved by the parliament," said one broker.
Traders said trade was limited to select index weighted shares and movements were narrow.

"The market is likely to show narrow movements for the time being particularly till the budget is passed, as the players have been adopting a cautious approach," said Bharat Bhushan of brokers Nu Era Equities.
Reliance Industries gained 0.90 rupees to 301.50 rupees on foreign buying, brokers said.
TISCO rose 1.05 rupees to 173.25 on speculative purchases, they said.
Hindustan Lever firmed up 14.00 rupees to 1,080.00.
